requirement_tested: A frontend dashboard displaying real-time solar power generation data
user_persona: A homeowner monitoring their home solar energy system.
user_goal: To see the current solar power being generated by their solar panels.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Maria opens the solar dashboard to check her system's performance. She expects to immediately see how much power her solar panels are generating.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A card labeled 'Solar Power Generation' appears with a honeydew background and dark olive green text, showing the latest value in kW along with a solar icon.

requirement_tested: A frontend dashboard displaying real-time power consumption data
user_persona: An environmentally conscious user wanting to track household electricity usage.
user_goal: To monitor how much electricity their house is currently consuming.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Consumption Metrics
narrative_steps.description: John logs into the dashboard and looks for his current power consumption to compare it against production.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main dashboard view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A card titled 'Power Consumption' displays the real-time usage in kW with appropriate styling and an icon.

requirement_tested: A frontend dashboard displaying real-time battery percentage data
user_persona: A user with a solar-plus-storage setup checking battery charge levels.
user_goal: To verify the current charge level of their home battery storage unit.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Battery Status
narrative_steps.description: Alex wants to ensure his battery has enough charge before peak hours begin.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A 'Battery Percentage' card is displayed showing the live percentage with correct visual styling and icon.

requirement_tested: Real-time data updates fetched from backend APIs at regular intervals
user_persona: A facility manager overseeing multiple renewable energy installations.
user_goal: To continuously monitor accurate, up-to-date metrics without manual refresh.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Live Updates
narrative_steps.description: Patricia notices the dashboard values automatically change every few seconds during daylight hours.
narrative_steps.action: Stay on the dashboard page for more than 5 seconds.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All real-time metric cards update automatically with new values fetched from backend APIs every 5 seconds.

requirement_tested: Historical data querying functionality with date range selection
user_persona: An analyst reviewing monthly energy efficiency reports.
user_goal: To analyze past energy patterns by selecting specific date ranges.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Historical Period
narrative_steps.description: David needs to pull last week's data to prepare a report. He uses the calendar widget to pick start and end dates.
narrative_steps.action: Open date range picker and select start and end dates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both start and end date fields populate with chosen values.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Query
narrative_steps.description: After choosing the dates, David submits the request to fetch historical records.
narrative_steps.action: Click the submit button next to the date picker.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System sends a GET request to the historical data API with selected timestamps and prepares charts for display.

requirement_tested: Chart visualization for historical solar power generation trends
user_persona: A solar installer demonstrating system performance to clients.
user_goal: To visually present how much solar energy was produced over time.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Solar Trend Chart
narrative_steps.description: Sam selects a date range and requests historical data specifically for solar generation trends.
narrative_steps.action: Submit a date range query after selecting desired dates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A line chart loads showing solar power generation over time with interactive tooltips available on hover.

requirement_tested: Chart visualization for historical power consumption trends
user_persona: A sustainability officer evaluating building energy efficiency.
user_goal: To understand historical electricity usage behavior for planning purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Consumption Trends
narrative_steps.description: Lisa queries historical data to evaluate weekly consumption fluctuations.
narrative_steps.action: Submit a date range to trigger loading of consumption trend chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A line chart representing historical power consumption over time renders with labeled axes and hoverable data points.

requirement_tested: Chart visualization for historical battery percentage trends
user_persona: A tech-savvy homeowner optimizing battery usage cycles.
user_goal: To review how their battery performed over different periods.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Battery Performance
narrative_steps.description: Raj examines how efficiently his battery charged and discharged throughout last month.
narrative_steps.action: Query historical data including battery metrics for a selected period.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A line chart illustrating battery percentage changes over time appears with responsive tooltips.

requirement_tested: Backend API endpoints serving real-time solar data
user_persona: A developer integrating third-party tools with the solar dashboard backend.
user_goal: To programmatically access current solar readings via RESTful API.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Real-Time Solar Data
narrative_steps.description: Developer Sam makes a direct call to the real-time solar endpoint to get the most recent reading.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response returns the latest solar power generation record retrieved from the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Backend API endpoints serving historical solar data
user_persona: A data scientist conducting long-term energy forecasting research.
user_goal: To extract large volumes of historical solar data through programmatic access.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Filtered Historical Records
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Kim sends an API request specifying a date range to obtain relevant historical datasets.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to `/api/historical/data?start=...&end=...` with valid timestamps.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns filtered historical entries matching the requested timeframe from the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Backend connecting to external PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A DevOps engineer deploying the solar dashboard application stack.
user_goal: To confirm successful database connectivity using predefined configuration settings.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: Jamie ensures that the backend service connects properly to the remote PostgreSQL instance using set environment variables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Application initializes a secure database connection pool using the provided DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_NAME values.

requirement_tested: Frontend styled with honeydew background color
user_persona: A UX designer validating front-end design implementation.
user_goal: To ensure consistent branding and theming across all pages.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Page Background
narrative_steps.description: Taylor checks if the dashboard adheres to brand guidelines requiring a honeydew background.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Entire webpage background is rendered in honeydew (#F0FFF0) as defined in CSS styles.

requirement_tested: UI components styled with dark olive green color scheme
user_persona: A quality assurance tester verifying UI consistency.
user_goal: To validate that all interactive elements follow the defined color theme.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Component Styling
narrative_steps.description: Casey inspects various UI components like cards and charts to confirm they match the required dark olive green styling.
narrative_steps.action: Load dashboard and inspect CSS properties of dashboard cards and chart containers.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All applicable components show dark olive green (#556B2F) for text and border colors according to style rules.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script for frontend and backend installation
user_persona: A new team member setting up the project locally for the first time.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies for both parts of the application with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing All Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clones the repository and wants to quickly install everything needed to run both frontend and backend services.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: NPM executes installation scripts sequentially for both frontend and backend folders without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to start frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A full-stack developer beginning daily development work.
user_goal: To launch both development environments with a single terminal command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Morgan begins working on enhancements and wants to spin up both local servers simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the project root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently launches both frontend and backend development servers, enabling integrated debugging and testing.
